page.title: 05Bulford Camp Then and Now
page.content: Bulford camp was built on the first 750 acres of Salisbury Plain purchased by the army in 1897.It was bought because the chalk land was ideal for training the Cavalry and Yeomanry.The original hutted camp was built in 1900 on the site of the present Sling Barracks.The railway extension linked Bulford Camp to Amesbury in 1906. Today there are six barracks, Sling, Ward, Gordon,Wing,Picton and Kiwi.The camp houses 3,000 Officers and Men. There is a Parachute, an Infantry and a Logistics Support Regiment. There is also a Gunner Battery,and a Field Ambulance Service.There are a number of small units collectively known as BATAU of which one is a transport RCT and the Military Police have a presence.The Ace Mobile Force is based at Bulford and it is the Headquarters South West District.
